Guangbu: "Lian, Tang Lian." Such as "Yi Li. Village Drinking Ceremony": "Set a table in the Tang Lian Dong Shang." Zheng Xuan's note: "The side is called Lian." "Han Shu. "The Biography of Jia Yi": "The respect of the lord is like a hall, the officials are like the prince, and the concubines are like the earth. Therefore, at the ninth level, if you are in Lianyuan, the hall is tall; if you are dead, if you are honest and close to the earth, then the hall is inferior." Ancient note: "Lian, side corner."

" Lian " by extension means edges and corners. "Guang Ya. "Explanation": "Lian, Leng Ye." Such as "Book of Rites. "Employment Yi": "Incorruption but not morality, righteousness." Kong Yingdashu: "Incorruption, ridgeliness. Mortality, wounds. It is said that although the jade body has integrity but does not hurt the things, the righteous can also be cut off. It does not hurt things, so it is right." "Wen Xin Diao Long. "Feng Chan": "To make the meaning of the past without obscurity in the depth, the writing of the present without falling to the shallow, the righteousness to shine, and the resignation to be Lian, then it is great."

" Lian " means that a person has an upright character and integrity. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Loyalty": "Therefore, it is not easy to be profitable. It can be said to be incorruptible. Therefore, honesty does not forget its humiliation with wealth." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Yu Shu" 7th Simplified: "Wise (knowledge) and dare to speak, is not cheap (also)."

" Lian " means inspection. Such as "Pipe. Righteous World: "If you live by the people who are not honest and change, the violent will be invincible, and the evil will not stop." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Incorruptible, check also." "Hou Han Shu. Biographies of Fang Shu: "Fighting to be furious, making people incorruptible, knowing the wife's fraudulent illness, is to collect and pay prison information, and test the first service."

" Lian " means frugality and saving. Such as "Huainanzi. "Yuan Dao": "Whoever gets what he gets, does not take extravagance as pleasure, nor incorruptibility as sorrow, close with Yin, and open with Yang." Gao Yin's note: "Incorruptible, still thrifty." Liu Zongyuan of the Tang Dynasty. The Stele of the Temple of the Second Concubine of Xiangyuan>: "Incorruptible use the surplus, so that you can gain merit." Jiang Zhiqiao's note: "Incorruption, festival."

" Incorruption " also means not to be greedy and not to be greedy, as opposed to " greedy ." Such as "Mencius. "Li Louxia": "You can take it, you can take it without taking it, and it hurts cheap." "Xunzi. "Jun Dao": "If so, those who are virtuous will continue to talk about it, and those who are greedy will retreat and those who are honest will start."

" Lian " later also expressed cheapness and low prices. For example, Wang Yucheng of the Northern Song Dynasty "The Story of a Newly Built Small Bamboo House in Huangzhou": "The bamboo craftsman breaks it, cuts its knots, replaces the terracotta, it is more common than the house, because of its low price, it is also a province." Pu Songling in the Qing Dynasty . "Li Boyan": "One person sells maidservants, and the king knows that he is wrong, but he is upright and honest, so he buys it."

" Lian " is also the last name. "Tong Chi. "The Fourth Clan": "The Lian clan, after the great-grandson of Emperor Zhuan Dalian, he named his clan as Wangfu. Zhao Youlianpo, Liandan and Lianfan in Han Dynasty. Song Lianbu, Dengke, from Chuzhou; Lian Caoyi, Changzhou people."

humanum_full_description:
從「广」，「兼」聲。本義是堂屋的側邊。《說文》：「廉，仄也。从广，兼聲。」段玉裁注：「堂之邊曰廉。」《玉篇．广部》：「廉，堂廉也。」如《儀禮．鄉飲酒禮》：「設席於堂廉東上。」鄭玄注：「側邊曰廉。」《漢書．賈誼傳》：「人主之尊譬如堂，群臣如陛，眾庶如地。故陛九級上，廉遠地，則堂高；陛亡級，廉近地，則堂卑。」顏師古注：「廉，側隅也。」

　　「廉」引申表示棱角。《廣雅．釋言》：「廉，棱也。」如《禮記．聘義》：「廉而不劌，義也。」孔穎達疏：「廉，棱也。劌，傷也。言玉體雖有廉棱而不傷割於物，人有義者亦能斷割而不傷物，故云義。」《文心雕龍．封禪》：「使意古而不晦於深，文今而不墜於淺，義吐光芒，辭成廉鍔，則為偉矣。」

　　「廉」表示人的性格剛直、品行端正。如《呂氏春秋．忠廉》：「故臨大利而不易其義，可謂廉矣。廉故不以貴富而忘其辱。」《睡虎地秦簡．語書》第7簡：「智（知）而弗敢論，是即不廉殹（也）。」

　　「廉」表示考察。如《管子．正世》：「過在下人君不廉而變，則暴人不勝，邪亂不止。」尹知章注：「廉，察也。」《後漢書．方術列傳》：「操大怒，使人廉之，知妻詐疾，乃收付獄訊，考驗首服。」

　　「廉」表示節儉、節省。如《淮南子．原道》：「夫得其得者，不以奢為樂，不以廉為悲，與陰俱閉，與陽俱開。」高誘注：「廉，猶儉也。」唐代柳宗元〈湘沅二妃廟碑〉：「廉用積余，以就爾功。」蔣之翹輯注：「廉，節也。」

　　「廉」亦表示不貪心、不苟取，與「貪」相對。如《孟子．離婁下》：「可以取，可以無取，取傷廉。」《荀子．君道》：「如是，則德厚者進而佞說者止，貪利者退而廉節者起。」

　　「廉」後來還表示便宜、價格低。如北宋王禹偁〈黃州新建小竹樓記〉：「竹工破之，刳去其節，用代陶瓦，比屋皆然，以其價廉而工省也。」 清代蒲松齡《聊齋志異．李伯言》：「一人賣婢，王知其所來非道，而利其直廉，遂購之。」

　　「廉」也是姓氏。《通志．氏族略四》：「廉氏，顓帝曾孫大廉之後，以王父字為氏。趙有廉頗，漢有廉丹、廉范。宋廉布，登科，楚州人；廉操毅，昌州人。」
